div.l: Grese tyme is goon my fodir is forage
This white topp writith myne old ȝeris
Myn hert is also mowlid as myne heris
But thus I fare as doith an opyn hers
That fruyte is evir lenger the wers
Til it be rotyn in mullok or in stree
Wee old folk I drede so fare wee
Tyl wee be rotyn wee can nat ripe
We hope al wey whils wee may pipe
For in our will ther͗e stikkith evir a nayll
To have an hore hede ⁊and a green tayll
As hath a leek for þouȝ our myȝt be goon
Our will deservith evir in oon
For when wee may nat do then woll wee speke
Ȝit in our͗e asshis is old feer I reke
Four gledis have wee wich I shall devise
Avawntyng lying and covetise
These four sparkelis long to elde
Our͗e old lymmys may wee nat weld
But will shall nat fail it is soth
And ȝit have wee al wey a coltis tothe
As many yeeris as is passid hen
Sith my topp of lyff be gan to ren
For sikirly when I was born a noon
Deth drawith the tap of lyff ⁊and lete it goon
And evir sith hath the tapp I ronne
Tyll almost empty is the tun
The streme of lyff droppith ovir the chyn
The sely tunge may wele clap ⁊and clym
Of wrecchidnes that passid is ful yore
With olde folk save dotage ther͗e is no more
When that our hoost had herd þis ʆsermonyng
He gan to speke as lordly as a kyng
He seyd what a mow̄nith al this witt
What shuld wee speke al day of holy writt
The devill made the Reve for to preche
Or of sowter a shipman or a leche
